metadata.titleEn: Carbon and oxygen isotopic features of marine carbonate rocks from the Shuangdiandaban section in Ali area, Tibet (359-340 Ma)
metadata.description: In South China, standard Carboniferous δ13Ccarb curves have been established, but the isotopic patterns and values in different sections and regions can be quite different. Before the use of δ13Ccarb records to reveal global marine carbon cycling, it is necessary to conduct sedimentary facies and diagenesis analyses and compare numerous isotopic records on a global scale, in order to learn the global versus local contribution in a δ13C record. 201 geochemical samples were collected from the Yueyahu Formation for carbon and oxygen isotopic analyses, in order to reveal carbon cycling process(the TICE event) in northern Qiangtang/or Songpan-Ganzi and evaluate alternation of carbon isotopic records during diagenesis. This dataset includes 201 carbon and oxygen isotopic records.
metadata.instructions: The file name is "Carbon and oxygen isotopic features of marine carbonate rocks from the Shuangdiandaban section in Ali area, Tibet", which is composed of research site (Ali area, Tibet) + section name (the Shuangdiandaban section) + data type (inorganic carbon and oxygen isotope geochemical data). The data is stored in XLS format and can be opened and read by Microsoft Office Excel software.

Disjunctive.Question: Is the collection of carbon and oxygen isotope data in marine carbonate rocks more effectively conducted through sampling and analysis of core samples, surface outcrops, or a combination of both methods?

Concept Completion.Question: What are the common challenges in collecting inorganic carbon isotope geochemical data from marine carbonate rocks in different regions?

Quantification.Question: How many samples were collected for carbon and oxygen isotope analysis in a dataset exploring early Carboniferous marine carbonate rocks in the North Qiangtang/Songpan-Ganzi block?

Definition.Question: What does 'δ13C值变化趋势' mean in the context of carbon isotope studies in marine carbonate rocks?
Definition.Answer: 'δ13C值变化趋势' refers to the trend or variation in the carbon isotope ratio (δ13C) values in marine carbonate rocks, which can indicate differences in carbon cycling processes and potentially reveal regional or global changes in the carbon isotope composition of the ocean over time.
